Class HuffmanTree

java.lang.Object
  HuffmanTree

public class HuffmanTree
extends java.lang.Object

Allows user to choose a .txt file and constucts utilizes a Huffman Tree to encode and decode the contents of the file

Version:
03/06/2013
Author:
Joel Sigo

Constructor Summary
HuffmanTree(java.io.File t)
          constructor for a HuffmanTree object
 
Method Summary
 void decodeMessage()
          decodes the encoded message and displays the decoded message
 void determineFrequencies(java.lang.String s)
          iterates through String that is passed in and stores information into a HashMap, the "key" is represented by a Character and the Value is represented by an HNode.
 void displayAverage()
          displays the average number of bits per symbol used in the encoded file
 void displayFreqTable()
          displays the frequency table
 void displayTree()
          displays the huffman tree generated by contents of file with each level represented by a different level of indentation
 void encodeTree(java.io.File t)
          generates an "encoded message" based off of the contents of the file, creates a lookup table which indicates char and code associated with that char
static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

Method Detail

decodeMessage

public void decodeMessage()
decodes the encoded message and displays the decoded message

determineFrequencies

public void determineFrequencies(java.lang.String s)
iterates through String that is passed in and stores information into a HashMap, the "key" is represented by a Character and the Value is represented by an HNode. Determines the frequency for which each char in the string occurs and stores it into the appropriate HNode or "value"

Parameters:
s - String to be evaluated

displayAverage

public void displayAverage()
displays the average number of bits per symbol used in the encoded file

public void displayFreqTable()
displays the frequency table

displayTree

public void displayTree()
displays the huffman tree generated by contents of file with each level represented by a different level of indentation

encodeTree

public void encodeTree(java.io.File t)
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
generates an "encoded message" based off of the contents of the file, creates a lookup table which indicates char and code associated with that char

Parameters:
t - File to be evaluated
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException
